tool.name: PreliminaryGrading
tool.displayname: Single Axis Tracker Preliminary Grading Assesment

param.name: demExist
param.dialogReference: The raster dataset or mosaic dataset that represents elevation values from the preliminary grading assessment will be derived.
param.pythonReference: Raster should be in a projected coordinate system, preferably State Plane or UTM. Vertical units for the raster much match the horizontal units of the projection.

param.name: aoi_boundary
param.dialogReference: Polygon that defines the area to be assessed.
param.pythonReference: The raster should extend at least one tracker full length beyond this area

param.name: xyzUnit
param.dialogReference: Identifies the vertical and horizontal units of the Input elevation raster and tracker length (Foot or Meter). Vertical units for the raster much match the horizontal units of the projection as well as the units of the tracker length.

param.name: tracker_length
param.dialogReference: The length of the tracker rows in feet or meters. Tracker lengths can be an estimate. Default: 300

param.name: revTolerance
param.dialogReference: The reveal “window.” For example, a minimum reveal of 4 ft and a maximum reveal of 5 ft would be a 1 ft reveal tolerance. Must be in the units of the Elevation and horizontal units (feet or meters)

param.name: cutOutput
param.dialogReference: A raster dataset that represents the theoretical cut
param.pythonReference: Must not have spaces, dashes, or unique characters.

param.name: fillOutput
param.dialogReference: A raster dataset that represents the theoretical fill
param.pythonReference: Must not have spaces, dashes, or unique characters.

param.name: cutFillOption
param.dialogReference: An option that will allow for the calculation of grading volumes for the area of interest

param.name: statsOutput
param.dialogReference: A standalone table that provides grading volume statistics for the analysis
param.pythonReference: Must not have spaces, dashes, or unique characters

param.name: exclusionOption
param.displayname: Create exclusion areas based on maximum cut and/or fill?
param.dialogReference: Option to create exclusion areas based on a maximum cut or fill depth (not volume)

param.name: cutFillLimit
param.displayname: Exclude cut or fill more than...
param.dialogReference: Depth of cut or fill to be excluded

param.name: exclusionOut
param.dialogReference: Output feature class dataset (polygon) that defines the exclusion areas that exceed the cut and fill limit

tool.summary: Generates cut and fill rasters and optional grading statistics for a given elevation dataset without a defined layout. The tool iterates through potential row placements across the input elevation raster based on the input tracker length.
tool.usage:
• This tool outputs a theoretical grading assessment based on an iterative approach to identify where grading is most likely to occur.

  • No layout is required, but results should be treated as preliminary.

  • Outputs are two rasters – a raster representing cut depths and one representing fill depths. If a preliminary graded surface is desired, the cut and fill rasters can be mosaicked to the existing elevation raster (a future version will add this as an optional output along with volumes). Volumes can then be determined by using the Cut and Fill Analysis or Zonal Cut and Fill Analysis as needed. Any volume statistics derived are preliminary and are typically an over-estimate of the Grading Estimate tool. Final cut and fill areas based on a layout will depend on tracker row placement.

  • This tool is most useful to guide layout design to avoid areas where grading will be problematic. A future version will allow for exclusion areas to be defined based on user-defined parameters.

If the buildable area is well defined, the volume statistics are valuable for early cost estimates for the site. To be conservative, KiloNewton recommends adding 20%-30% to the results of this tool.

idCitation.resTitle: Single Axis Tracker Preliminary Grading Assessment
